title: Getting to Know Plants
description: Learn about different parts of plants, their functions, and types of plants.

questions.question: Which part of the plant absorbs water and minerals from the soil?
questions.explanation: Roots absorb water and minerals from the soil and anchor the plant in the ground.

questions.question: What is the main function of leaves?
questions.explanation: Leaves make food for the plant through the process of photosynthesis, using sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide.

questions.question: Which of these is a tap root?
questions.explanation: Carrot has a tap root system with one main root growing deep into the soil.

questions.question: What is the function of the stem?
questions.explanation: The stem supports the plant and transports water, minerals, and food between roots and leaves.

questions.question: Which of these is a herb?
questions.explanation: Tulsi is a herb because it has a soft stem and is used for medicinal purposes.

questions.question: What is the main function of flowers?
questions.explanation: Flowers are the reproductive parts of plants that produce seeds for new plants.

questions.question: Which of these is a shrub?
questions.explanation: Rose is a shrub because it has a woody stem and is smaller than a tree.

questions.question: What is the function of stomata?
questions.explanation: Stomata are tiny pores on leaves that allow the exchange of gases (oxygen and carbon dioxide) and water vapor.

questions.question: Which of these is a climber?
questions.explanation: Money plant is a climber because it needs support to grow upward and has weak stems.

questions.question: What is the function of chlorophyll?
questions.explanation: Chlorophyll is the green pigment in leaves that helps plants make food through photosynthesis.
